8ball.no_response: I'd rather not respond to this question

setwelcome.noPermission: :x: **You need to have the `MANAGE_GUILD` permission to use this command.**
setwelcome.step1:
:white_check_mark: **Alright, let's start the setup. First, which channel do you want the welcome messages to be in?
To see an example, run ${prefix}exwelcome 
You can type `cancel` to stop the setup.

`Type the name of the channel the welcome messages you want to be in.`**
setwelcome.invalidChannel: :x: **Invalid channel name! Check if the entered channel's name is correct and then type the command again.**
setwelcome.invalidTextChannel: :x: **Invalid text channel! Check if the entered text channel's name is correct and then type the command again.**
setwelcome.noMessagePermission: :x: **I can't send messages in that channel! Please make sure that I have the `SEND_MESSAGES` permission in that channel and then type the command again.**
setwelcome.step2: :white_check_mark: **Channel set. What should the title be?**
setwelcome.step3: :white_check_mark: **Title set. What should the author be?**
setwelcome.step4: :white_check_mark: **Author set. What should the description be?**
setwelcome.finished: :white_check_mark: **Alright, I set the welcome message for this guild!**

tickets.nomodRole:
:x: This server doesn't have a `Support Team` role made, so the ticket won't be opened.
If you are an administrator, make one with that name exactly and give it to users that should be able to see tickets.
tickets.donthaveRole: :x: Sorry! You do not have the **${role}** role.
tickets.wrongChannel: :x: You can't use the add command outside of a ticket channel.
tickets.wrongChannelClose: :x: You can't use the close command outside of a ticket channel.
tickets.closeConfirm:
Are you sure? Once confirmed, you cannot reverse this action!
To confirm, type `${prefix}confirm`. This will time out in 20 seconds and be cancelled.
tickets.added: ${user} has been added to the ticket!
tickets.removed: ${user} has been removed from the ticket!
tickets.existingTicket: :x: You already have a ticket open!
tickets.ticketMessage:
**Hey there, ${nick}!, A member from the Support Team will be with you soon!**
Please try to explain your issue while you are waiting.
